meanings.definition: The act of incorrectly setting the price of something.
meanings.sent1: The mispricing of the toy made it too expensive for many kids to buy.
meanings.sent2: The mispricing of the house led to it being on the market for a long time.
meanings.sent3: The mispricing of the ice cream caused a lot of confusion at the store.
meanings.sent4: The mispricing of the concert tickets left many fans disappointed.
meanings.sent5: The mispricing of the car made it seem like a luxury vehicle.

meanings.definition: To set the price of something inaccurately.
meanings.sent1: The store owner accidentally mispriced the new products on the shelves.
meanings.sent2: If you misprice the items, customers may not want to buy them.
meanings.sent3: I mispriced the cookies so low that they were sold out within minutes.
meanings.sent4: She mispriced her services, leading to financial losses for her business.
meanings.sent5: Be careful not to misprice the items, or you might lose money.
